page.title: 20 Bostock
page.content: Bostock is a small village of 250 people, situated on the A533 Northwich to Middlewich road. There are facilities for tennis and bowls and a social club. There are no shops and the children have to travel to Davenham or Middlewich to attend school. The surrounding countryside is used as grazing land. In the fields are many clumps of trees which are used as breeding grounds for Pheasants. One of the old trees in the village is said to mark the centre of the county of Cheshire. Winsford salt mines spread under Bostock and explosions can be heard at the same time every day. Bostock Hall is found in the village. It was previously owned by Colonel France Hayhurst, for whom many of the local people worked.
